name: Teja Singh Samundri
birthPlace: Rai Ka Burj, Tarn Taran tehsil, Amritsar district, Punjab
excerpt: Teja Singh Samundri was a prominent Sikh religious reformer, an Akali leader, and a key activist in the Gurdwara Reform Movement. He was a founding member and later Vice-President of the Shiromani Gurdwara Parbandhak Committee (SGPC), playing a pivotal role in asserting Sikh control over their historical shrines.
designation: Sikh Religious Reformer, Akali Leader, Freedom Fighter, SGPC Founder
